question.title: Change coordinate system from top to bottom left corner for angles
question.body:
I want in Java to change the coordinate system for an Arc2D which has a startAngle and an angleExtent from the Java coordinate system (reference is top left corner) to another which is bottom left corner. My use case it that I want to convert from Java Arcs to ARINC 661 Arcs (contrary to Java, ARINC 661 is bottom left).

I know that there are questions in StackOverflow about this change of coordinate system for positions (for exemple: Change coordinates to bottom left corner), but I could not find it for angles.

When I am doing this I "almost" have the correct result (in most cases) but it is still not correct in many cases, so I know that this is not the correct formula:

  double angleStart = arc.getAngleStart();
  angleStart = angleStart - 180;
  angleStart %= 360;

  double angleExtent = arc.getAngleExtent();
  if (angleExtent < 0) {
     angleExtent = 360 - angleExtent;
  }
  double angleEnd = angleStart + angleExtent;

question_comments.body: The reply from @VGR will likely satisfy. However, an affine transform will handle what you need, and allow for other rotations as well. Any number of libraries should apply an affine transform to an array of points very quickly.

To change the coordinate system, I would transform the Graphics2D where you are doing your drawing. For example: graphics.translate(0, getHeight()); graphics.scale(0, -1); Be sure to preserve the original transform before drawing, and restore the original transform when your code is finished drawing.
